snippet: The decision, announced after an extension to the eurozone bailout program was granted, could usher in a leftist party opposed to austerity measures.
abstract: Greece's Prime Min Antonis Samaras calls for Parliament to elect new president, accelerating selection in gamble to gain vote of confidence in his center-right government; decision shakes stock market, which falls 12.78 percent.

byline.contributor: Dimitris Bounias and Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The decision, announced after an extension to the eurozone bailout program was granted, could usher in a leftist party opposed to austerity measures.

headline.main: In Political Gamble, Greek Premier Speeds Up Presidential Vote
headline.print_headline: In Political Gamble, Greek Premier Speeds Up Presidential Vote
